intro: Relhania apiculata, commonly known as the African mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at higher elevations. Relhania apiculata is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, moist climates.
